title: The old market
review: Tibetan Market is one of the old shopping places in Nainital. The market is adjacent to the famous Naina Devi Temple. The market is not very big and it's difficult to walk in the narrow lanes. You can find variety of woolen garments, junk jewelries, shoes, bags etc.and to buy something don't forget to bargain.But believe me,there will be NO guaranty for quality. The place is famous also for Tibetan momo and you must try this.

title: lovely Wollens
review: you can all kinds of beautiful tibetian things . Wollens , hand bags, travel bags , tea sets and many more things . All of them are so beautiful . You must bargain in these shops.

title: average market experience
review: Its doable with mall road. Not a must visit but good to spend some time in eve and if one wish to buy some woolen items. Like other woolen markets, it has nothing spacial to offer.

title: Nice shopping venue
review: Nice place to shop near Naini lake and Mall road. You can get good bargains for clothes. You can have boating in Naini lake, visit the Nainadevi temple and visit the market at the exit of the temple.

title: Ok place
review: A place where many things are available for shopping lovers and at good price you can get so many things if you are shopping lover

title: This is the place....
review: The only shopping area in nainital which offers clothes and footwear at reasonable rates. They mostly import yhe stuff from china and near by countries.

title: Colourful Market For Seeing Street Life
review: This market has something for everyone but for the tourist has many cheap things but maybe not of the quality you may want. The fruit and veg part is interesting too, but we really enjoying watching the people haggling over their purchases. Street food available but we did not try these as we were unsure of the contents. Good fun.

title: Nothing great
review: Tibetan market in Nainital doesnt offer any exciting or different variety of things, most of it is already there in our local markets.  the price too are on the higher side

title: Not so Good
review: The market is loosing its charm . Heard a lot but found nothing extraordinary in terms of products and price. Tendency to go for fixed pricing in many shops may be one of the reason. People like bargaining however if fixed prices has yo bebgiven then they go for branded shops. ...hope the market gainsbits lost charm.

title: Bargaining market
review: This is very busy market in mallital. If anyone can bargain here, he can get good things at good prices.

title: a nice colorful market
review: if you are a delhite, this market wont thrill you as it houses all items available in markets like delhi hat, janpath, palika etc....however for tourists its a nice place, its a market selling toys, garments, woolen items, wooden stuff and whatnot....and there are a few very nice and famous food joints as well..eg. Sonam's momos...etc.

title: Busy
review: This is quite a busy market. You will see all kinds of items sold here - from clothes to shoes. And most of them seem like Chinese products and are available for an excellent bargain. There are also a few famous food stalls here - Sonams momos being one of them.

title: Shopper's paradise & Light on Pocket
review: This Tibetan market is famous and crowded as most of the people visiting Nainital come here also...

title: Good decent market
review: I found this market is quite decent place for shopping at near Nainital Devi Temple...  Titration food shops &  are showing stuff is easily available at this place but prices are very high & you have very have to have good negations skill for shopping at this place...

title: Shopping place!!!
review: Tibetian market place is shopping place where we can buy lots of apparels, accessories and things are there. Nice collections.

title: Mixed Market
review: Good market at Tallital near Naini devi temple, its is quite mixed shopping for men,women, and children there are lots of woolen garment,food court, toy shops, and latest collection of lingerie available here run by tibetain ladies on reasonable price, but don't buy perfume it's all duplicate,must try momos here.

title: Same as every hill station.
review: Close to naina devi temple. This Tibetan mkt. same as you may found at every hill station. nothing extra ordinary.

title: Average market with mixed items and hiked prices
review: Tibetan market or Bhotia market near Nainital has a lot of shops. Items are pricier, but you can get good items if you bargain. Good woollen items are available but I believe they are much cheaper in Delhi as locals told that all these items come from Delhi only.

title: Tibetan Market - Average
review: Bhotia Market or Tibetan Market has a lots of shops selling garments and other stuff. Don't forget to bargain here as they ask too much for the stuff. Don't forget to eat at Sonam restaurant in the market.

title: Flea Market
review: Situated at the Mallital side of nainital, adjacent to the Naina Devi temple. The place offers a good variety of clothes and accessories specially winter apparels. However, being a Tibetan market i set my expectations too high to find something good to buy, but the place disappointed me. The price was way too high, although the material of jackets was good but still found it unworthy. Most of the shops has a Fixed Price policy and were not interested in negotiating the price. I did not find any thing worth buying here, shops on mall road offer much discount. But still give it a try if Naina devi temple is on your list.

title: Good variety
review: Lot of good variety some things are easily available like Sarojini Nagar market....have to bargain, it's quite crowded in the evening and weekends. Has a good view and parking lot nearby..and a movie hall...has some snacks available .

title: Not worth it. Lost its charm.
review: With changing market trends this market has lost its charm. There was a time when visiting this place was a to do thing but in recent times things are not so good. Products sold here are pricey and low quality. Food options aren't good and low too. Can go in free time to pass it else avoid.

title: An average overpriced market
review: Average market like any other mall road. Not as developed as shimla or manali. Ok kinds to pass time or buying stuff like earrings etc.

title: waste of time totally
review: there is nothing great .Its next to naini lake if you have nothing to do then you can waste some time here .It may be individuals interest too .I would rather spend sometime sitting near the lake or may the Temple or Gurudwara in the market

title: Nothing special as such!!
review: A small market, just in front of Naini temple. Market as name suggest is home to Tibetan famous products mostly suitable for cold mountainous climate. Though , commercialization has also resulted in lot many other shops not having any direct relation with Tibetan products such as nainital famous scented vandals, and other eatery joints.

title: Clothes Shopping
review: If you are in a mood to shop after the temple visit and boat ride, you can try out the Tibetan Market located just outside the complex.

title: Cheap and best
review: Tibetan market consists of small shops with variety of little things of daily use,even good bargain make you happy.a must visit place while in nainital

title: A Shoppers paradise
review: The market is next to the lake. It has shops selling all kinds of stuff from basic utilities to luxury and costly stuff. Even the international brands of garments, Shoes etc are available. A large variety of latest fashion dresses, umbrellas, hats etc offer.a.huge choice one cant resist to buy. We always spend half a day here. The market also is next to parkking so u can leave your materials in car too. The market has some fast food joints hence providing immediate relief to your hunger and thirst. It is advisable to carry a folding hand bag else u may have to buy one there.

title: Market  by the side of Lake
review: Market is located by the side of lake on mall road. All items such as candles, clothes , handicrafts , souvenir items  are available from cheapest quality to branded items.

title: Just like any hills market but do go there
review: Well its nothing much but at least a stroll through the whole market is a must. You will get local culture and tibetan food there.Dont buy anything there without a lot of bargain... Buy only if u must. It suddenly got cold in the hills and had to buy woolens for the kids...ONLY IF U MUST.

title: same as any other Tibetan market
review: good stop for buying items like woollen socks , gloves etc. one can enjoy street food like momos , chowmein , soups & sweetcorn . good place to brush up your bargaining skills. one can skip this if not interested.

title: Best Tibetan
review: This is easily one of the best Tibetan markets all the hill stations have. The stuff available here is good quality. Though you really need to have some good bargain skills, especially in the off season.

title: Just like other tibetan market
review: This is just like any other winter tibetan market in any other city,  Woolens are sold with good price to buy,  there are few shops selling natural flower and wood made show pieces,  you wont find these anywhere else

title: shopping and eating best junction
review: best place to shop for traditional clothes and wooden artefacts. they even have the unique candles which are so well designed, you wont believe that they are candles.

title: Tibetan culture
review: This place has nothing  special  in it.

title: Average market
review: It is average market selling  overpriced goods. Nothing special  is available here and hence you can skip this market. Shops sells clothes, candles, food and etc; do bargain before buying.

title: Mixed place for shoppers
review: The prices are high as being hill station but some bargaining can be done.

title: Not a big deal if you skip it.
review: It is located adjacent to Naina Devi temple and Naini lake. Items are cheap. One can buy candles from here with no bargain.If you have Mall road on your list of places to visit you will automatically end up covering this market. It was so so, nothing so extraordinary.

title: Tibet Market
review: There is a good options clothes specially for females . You can end your whole day buying and still there would be more options available with them . Yoh can baegain as well there and most of the sellers do go down with your Prices .

title: Good for shopping
review: Beautiful market on the one side and bank of Naini Lake,all type of products are available at reasonable price

title: nainital market
review: if someone likes to go for window shopping it is good place wherein you will find every type of clothes with huge variety...

title: Small market near parking
review: Its a small market near parking side clothing, under garments, kids toys, fancy item shop are there restaurant and food stalls are also there to enjoy, there is a very famous momos stall must try, but have to ask for the shop its in depth of the market.

title: A very new experience of North-East markets!
review: A lot of stalls from resident North-east people gives a new dimension to the journey asif we crossed the border into Nepal. Many of the products like woolen wear are affordable and easily bargained.

title: Ok Ok
review: I found this market, an OK OK one. You can find better products at competitive price at Mall road or Bara Bazar. But, you can visit it once.

title: Delicious Tibetan Cuisines
review: Besides the usual aspect of buying woollens, the various eateries at the Tibetan Market in Nainital are a must for those who dig Tibetan cuisines.  Momos and Thukpa are to die for!  Fried noodles and soups are delicious.  You could try them out at the narrow alley inside the market or in one of the half dozen restaurants that open out to the central courtyard.  We ate at a joint named Hard Rock(!) .... not the real Hard Rock Cafe ..... and the food was fantastic.  There are some restaurants in this locality that also serve the ubiquitous dosas and idlis, but they seemed out of place with the Tibetan setting.  For a filling Tibetan meal at inexpensive prices, this is surely the best eating place in Nainital.  Generally speaking, Nainital spoils one with a choice of restaurants - both regular and fine dining.  But in terms of value for money, the eateries at Tibetan Market take the cake.

title: Nice but not amazing
review: The one thing I like about the market is that you don't get hounded and you can look without Simone diving on top of you. They sell nothing amazing but next to the sports arena and the lake which makes a nice setting.

title: "Bhutia Market"
review: Its a walking distance from mall road.Its a small market where you can buy woollen seaters, socks, jackets, shoes,candles,etc. have some eateries. Its a good place to hang out in the evening time

title: Low cost shopping.
review: This is one of the oldest, traditional and popular markets of Nanital; amongst the tourists/visitors. The access to the market is available from the Mall Road , the Temple and the parking/flats. Most of the stuff here as toys, winter cloths , electric/electronic items, shoes etc are either from Delhi or from China; which is in abundance anywhere in any town in India. The only thing that makes your trip worth a walk to this place is the food items; if you like those items and do not mind the low hygiene levels around.

title: Bargain
review: most of the hill stations have these kinds of markets.

title: cool stuff and cheap price
review: u will get all cool stuff in cheap prices..they don't bargain much but price is cheap ..easily affordable and ok quality .

title: Good Time pas
review: good collection of readymad electronic and other in the market good time pas in market   and small resturent in market for low bazat traveller geting good food in tibbt market

title: Good place for shopping enthusiasts !!
review: The Tibetan market located very close to the Naina Devi temple around the Nainital lake on the Mall road is a good place for shopping enthusiasts. The place offers clothes, jewelry, toys, cosmetics, souvenirs, etc at reasonable rates. There are many options for food also available in this market.

title: Place to go on a shopping spree!!
review: This is just the place for shopping enthusiasts. You will find some small shops with lots of clothes and accessories, along with some great eating joints.

title: A nice evening walk
review: you can find cheap slippers, lots of  warm clothing, handicraft shops, cheap bed sheets and warm  blankets, its a good walk in to the small cheap shops

title: Good market at throw away price
review: You get good stuff here. unlike any other road side market.. this one is good.. keep walking and bargain along the way to strike a good deal. you got to be street smart in such markets. Located just close to the parking lot in Nanital. beware of monkeys. dont carry eatables in your hands.

title: Shopping Limited
review: Even though Nainital has a pretty large Tibetan market as compared to other hill stations, yet, there is really nothing unusual or different in this market. More than anything else, the market thrives on menswear predominantly and that too with a wide array of quality jackets

title: For shopping and Snacks
review: Good place for shopping and to grab some quick snacks. Situated near Naina Devi temple on one side and Parking at the other.

title: Shopping Paradise
review: The market is very good for visitors for shopping lovers where you can buy woollen garments,fashionable jackets,naughty Chinese lingerie's,night wears,toys,and some lovely fast food centre and some gift shop but do not buy buy perfumes all are fake,we love to buy colour candles which is famous in Nainital.

title: Small Market
review: Tibetan Market is one of the attractions in every hill station. This Tibetan market is on one side of Naini Lake near Naina Devi temple. You can buy here a lot of woolen items. There are many eateries for snacks item. I tasted samosa in one of eatery here, which was tasty.

title: Good But little bit expensive
review: its a good market but little bit expensive than any other tibetian market. there are lot of things to buy there specially wooleans

title: Good shopping place
review: The market is just adjacent to the naina devi temple and close to naini lake .The market offers wide variety of garments specially the western outfits. The woollens are also very good .Wide variety of luggage is also available.This is a must place to visit if in nanital.

title: Tibetan market
review: I may not recommend this place if you are from Metropolitan city as we have all Chinese goods at exorbitant price.

title: Ok
review: Seems like the only thing to do after walking past the lake ..I would say the mandatory ambling for all tourists ..

title: Good place to shop
review: Good experience in the Tibetian market, you get to see a lot of stuff which you wont get in the Metros so easily. Must have Momo's if you choose to visit the market. The overall shopping experience too was pretty good.

title: good local market for memorise the trip
review: You can buy all sort of dressings and shoes/sandals at very cheaper rate but all items are of low quality. You can say fashionable not so durable,

title: Tibetan Market mostly owned by localites or non Tibetan
review: The Market offers cheap designer apparels, footwears, toys.  I heard this market is like central market for localites. You can enjoy North Indian, South Indian, Chinese, cuisines here. The shopkeepers are hard to negotiate.  It all depends on your bargaining skills.

title: Just like any other market in any other town
review: This one is next to the lake and Naina devi temple....so flocked by tourist, but it is like an average market in any average town, and nothing extra to offer to most people! But maybe there are some people who like to purchase clothes here...India has all kind of people with varied taste....crowded...lot of eateries...

title: Nice Collections, good memories but just slightly, beware..
review: Collections at Tibetan Market is simply awesome. I Have rarely seen such great collections all at one place. While Women simply get mesmerized by the variety.. men can rejoice the feeling of seeing their loved ones so Happy. While this place is mostly for feminine items, men can also find some T-Shirts which they may like.

title: Just average
review: It is just like any other market in any other city. The place is crowded n the stuff is the regular stuff, nothing outstanding or extraordinary. All in all can certainly be skipped.

title: Shopping paradise
review: The place is packed with great stuff. The prices are very affordable for some great finds. I ended up purchasing lots of winter wear - trench coat, fur hats, woolen funky pants. The place also has some good momo places

title: Good stuff
review: The market has good n trendy stuff. U have to negotiate a bit at each shop. Some shops r fixed price. If u like street shopping then this market is good timepass.

title: Average Shopping Place
review: There might be  a time when this place might be a good visit but I didn't find it worthy. This Market is flooded with Chinese and Ludiana made woolen clothes. I was expecting to buy something from Tibateen Culture , but could not find it.

title: Lost its sheen
review: There was a time when this place was a good visit but nowadays its not worth. Quality of momos and noodles has gone down. Nothing good to shop mostly China make clothing and toys. But if you just wanna roam around its fine.

title: Must go
review: A very famous shopping area at Nainitial where one should definitely go for good quality fashion at a reasonable price. But be sure that you are good at bargaining.

title: Nice place to shop
review: This place has nice collection of warm clothes and souvenirs in reasonable price. But they ask for higher charge from tourist so don't forget to bargain.

title: Shopaholics attraction !!
review: if you are looking to shop in nainital you must go to this market offers cheap stuff and good stuff, lot of bargaining, good availability of items, good momos, facilities good.

title: Shopping time for those addicted.
review: Can buy the usual stuff here. For those "Compulsive Shoppers"  type. Not that you get something extraordinary here.

title: Good for shopping
review: Market very near the famous Naini temple and naini lake. Must purchase the winter cloths they are very hot and cozy type.

title: Lingerie & Garment Market
review: The market is worth to buy lingerie which are good and uncommon in other market and made in China, other than some good woolen garment can be buy form here,it is paradise for fast food lovers,there are several shops of eating and entertainments for children like toy shops,car driving,skating, Video games etc.

title: Shoppers Paradise
review: A flea (sort of) market where you can find a large variety of items and a typical Tibetan market with deals

title: Shopping Place
review: A very famous shopping area at Nainitial .if you are looking to shop in nainital you must go to this market.

title: Bargaining Market
review: This market is loacted close to Goddess Naina Devi temple, Mall Road etc Several shops are here which generally deal in Winter, woolen garments. I explored a lot here but didn't purchased anything. Some of the shopkeepers were saying that the itmes are brought from Tibet, some said they are from Bangkok, China etc and some were claiming (which I think is Right) that the items are the same that you find any market of Delhi, Mumbai etc.

title: He he ha ha ! Paradise For Girls and Shopholics !
review: Guys if you love your wife or girlfriend then take her to this place adjacent to Naina Devi Temple and she will thank you for the deal. This is a market where you can get a variety of daily use n seasinal use clothes specially woolens. This place has lot more to offer for Hunks too.

title: Best market to by Souvenir
review: It is the best market in Nainital to buy Souvenir for friends and families while returning from the trip. Various types of candles and woolen clothes are the things to buy. Do try Momos at the restaurants nearby....

title: Mutton momos
review: The only thing attractive about this place were the momos...

title: Quaint and Interesting
review: This is a small but well laid out market where you get artefacts, antiques etc. what sells most are woollens given the predominantly cool climate of nainital throughout the year. With the Naina Devi temple and the Naini Lake adjoining the market , one should list it down as a must see if only for its hustle-bustle and liveliness on any given day.

title: nice small market
review: the tibetan market is small nice market located at the end of the "mall",

title: Good for Shopaholics
review: It's actually between good and average. They have got some rows of stores, but compared to many other markets in Delhi, Hyderabad, Chennai, and even Cochin, the Tibetan Market is quite small. And you get to the actual Tibetan stores at the end. Till then, the stores are mixed. Candles, toys, woolen and other dress stuff, a little bit of handicrafts is what is there. None of them, unavailable outside Nainital, too. And if you want handicrafts, you better take a walk along Mall road. But it's fun to walk through the little alleyways there. You can always buy some knick-knacks.

title: Momos and Shopping
review: Its one the places you get on every indian hill station, the Tibetan market. In terms of catalogue, there is not much unique and you will get almost all the items in delhi for cheaper prices.

title: Not exactly a Tibetan market
review: This is just a name and you hardly can  find anything related to Tibet , its just another local market .

title: Love this
review: this is a nice place to hang out

title: Average market
review: This is local Market in mallital near nainadevi temple.all items are generally expensive.not worth to buy from here as same are available everywhere but remember to buy few good designer candels for yourself & gift purpose.

title: Mini-Tibet - Not Really!!
review: I visited Nanital in March'2015 on a cool rainy day with friends.we looked around the Tibet Market & had Momo's.A must try there.

title: Jackets for INR 550 available here
review: This market is not as big as the Barra Bazaar but holds something unique about it. Located adjacent to the Naina Devi temple here tasty momos and other fast food are available galore. The shopkeepers are open to bargaining but one cannot assure much success out of the haggle. INR 100-200 can be reduced. Jackets start from INR 800. Though a particular type of jacket is available in the range of INR 600. I bought it for INR 550 after haggling. The shopkeepers are not rude.

title: shopping spree
review: the place is for shopping and its really good...cant say that it is cheap, you have to bargain for getting good deals..you will get most of the woolen items and bags....

title: Shopper's paradise in Nainital!!!
review: Tibetan Market is near Naini Devi Temple beside the Nainital lake. It is a small market but perhaps has the maximum visitors - reason being being it is a shoppers paradise. One can buy souvenirs, woolen garments,toys, gift items and what not... but make sure to bargain. Off course decorative candles are much sought after  as they are quite famed here..and .if you are hungry you can opt for variety of fast foods..momos,chinese,south indian etc etc.....The place is crowded but suits everyone's pocket hence gets lots of footfall.

title: fashion hubbb,.,. must visit whenever u r in Nainital
review: this is must visit place in Nainital. Good hub for shopping with cool t-shirts and other apparels for all. Bit costly and it depends how you bargain ,.,., i will say must visit whenever you are on visit of town..

title: Good Place to Buy Stuffs
review: E wen to see the place and started shopping there, its one good place to buy and spend time in shopping.

title: Best momos
review: If you want to taste the best of momos, this is the place.

title: For Shoppers and Eaters!!
review: Gave one extra rating for the delicious momos.

title: No one cares of customers.
review: Overpriced. No seller really cares for customer. Leave the shopping part for mussorie if you are planning to visit

title: A good way to help tibetan small scale market
review: Though all over India in all hill stations we have one similar market selling same kind of goods like winter cloths, socks, umbrella, t shirts etc but it is good to see India helping Tebet in whichever way possible. Also they are not over priced and quality is alright. So I prefer to buy atleast one or two things for me or sometimes as gifts

title: Crowded
review: Cheap Stuff at negotiable rates

title: Too much hyped
review: Tibetan market is located on one end of the Naini lake, its very close to the Sikh Gurudwara, Naini Devi temple ...

title: More of the usual stuff than anything special
review: Most(like at 90% of the store) of the items you get here can be found at any place anytime. I dont see a point in selling t-shirts, shoes and such here, but people seem to buy them anyway.

title: It okey
review: Its seems same as tibetan market else. But to pass the time you can definitely visit the market. But you get clothes and toys more over there.

title: Mar2014
review: Bargaining has to be at your best visiting here. Nice things to buy the market is big and nice time pass. Try the dimsums and soup too when it gets cold.

title: Pandora Box!
review: It is just like pandora box, all items are available here, some locally made but mostly China made. Very near to Naina Temple. You have to be ready for big bargain.

title: brand street
review: This is a very good market for tourists. here one can find the same branded clothes at very low prices. the quality is good. its a main attractions near Naina devi temple

title: Tibetan market
review: Anything in woolens, a MUST VISIT to Tibetan Market. Despite not being local, the Tibetans shop owners are very friendly, helpful.

title: Fun and Colorful
review: A walk through the market is fun and colorful. The vendors are not pushy just sitting quietly waiting for business. The market path leads around toward the cold side of the lake where a walking path will take you on a circuit around the lake. Nice to do in the evenings.

title: Great shops and food
review: Great place to find high quality souvenirs and clothing, plus good food options. Try the real steamed momos.

title: Flee Market
review: A perfect place for quick shopping, the range of products available is completely different. Be it clothes, perfumes, showpieces every thing is available. Please ensure negotiating before buying any product.

title: Tibetan market rvw of nainitaal
review: it does not have any thing spl.. rates are high & response from shop keepers are not good... Do not waste much time here

title: Inexpensive
review: Tibetan Market was some 200 metres from our Hotel Channi Raja in Nainital.  The market is quite adjacent to the Nani Devi Temple too.  During our leisure time we used to visit the market.  It’s an average market with inexpensive winter garments and so on.  During our three days staying in Nainital, with several visits to the market, we, however, became skilled at bargaining and bought quite a few.  The behaviour of the shopkeepers is no doubt, appreciable.

title: Time Pass
review: Lot is given about this place. Not sure why I did not find attractive. You did have all those Tibetan  members having their stall selling candles and other Chinese stuff. May be a stroll after the boating. You do have some good South Indian food stalls. Have dosa.

title: Flea Market...
review: Located adjacent to Naina Devi temple, this market has nothing much to offer other than average quality winter clothes, low grade toys, cheap electronics , artificial jewelry and street food. Price quoted is high and bargaining is common.

title: Must visit if you are shopaholic!!
review: Very nice market!! Bargain!

title: Nice Market to buy gifts
review: beautiful and very nice market to buy gifts for your family and friends. We bought some candles of different shapes and designs.

title: Downmarket
review: Its on d one corner of d lake near d temple naina devi cheap poor quality stuff available be it clothes shoes toys bought frm wholesale markets of bigger cities the entire tibetian market are encroached shanties run by these huge bunch of nuisance creator sort of college or school drop outs oggling at every passerby ya d stuff is not highly priced but not even worth d price one is payin and if they can they will cheat on you period i bought 10pairs of woollen socks the ordinary kinds but it costed me 750 bucks mayb commission included of d driver who guided me to that shop even d eateries r so downmarket pathetic food unhygenic the very smell gets to me avoid is a better word

title: Woolens worth buying
review: Can get a good deal on woolens.Lots of bargaining.But some shops have good stuff worth buying.Some near mall road as good as well.Also try a local momo's point inside the market,a small shop in between.Worth visit once.

title: just cannot miss it while in nainital
review: all the best shopping deals in nainital are available here....Just no tourist can feel that trip to nainital is over without shopping here...you come here and just cannot go back without buying something....all the shops here are good with very courteous owners.

title: shoppers delight
review: had a great time striking bargains! and ofcourse really enjoyed our maggi and various snacks available by the lake side

title: Very nice place for shopping
review: This market is a very nice place for shopping especially for buying warm clothes, candles, shoes, etc. This place had a restaurant named China Town, with very good Chinese food.

title: Variety of cheap goods
review: Nice location, bang after naina devi temple and boating ..get ready to lose few hours and atleast a thousand bucks.. Good options for ladies with all types of dresses,purses..

title: local market near naini lake by tibetians
review: its a local market by tibetian people where they sell various items mainly woolens, garments,sweaters,shawls, kids toys, candles,gift items etc .Restaurants are also situated nearby, this market is near  naini lake and naina devi temple

title: shopping here is all about bargain...
review: the mall is few steps away from Naina Devi Temple...it ll be good to visit there @ evening...take a walk from temple to mall,I prefered riksha after shopping...it was nice...there are a no: of shops including clothes esp. salwar,tees n tops,woollen shawls,sweater,Nainital spcl candles n all...a budget shopping can be done...ofcourse variety of fries n drinks are available...happy shopping :-)

title: market on flat
review: Situated on flat in Nainital this is a popular market for  tourists selling various items,albeit of cheap quality.There are a number of eating joints also.The famous Naina Devi temple is close by.

title: Too hyped.
review: The place is recommended a lot however didn't seem as good as the hype. Cheap stuff with bargains aplenty.

title: Great Market, Great Food
review: This market sells clothes, shoes and anything  you can imagine. You can get anything from souvenirs to authentic tibetan food which is THE BEST i have had in a long time.

title: Good place to buy winter clothes
review: You have to bargain here but the quality of goods are really nice and they have a large variety to choose from. From mufflers to jackets, we get a wide range of varieties. also the food in some of the restaurants are really nice at affordable price. there is an craft shop inside the market. It has some really nice wooden showpieces as well as candles. Overall nice place to visit and enjoy.

title: Good place to visit
review: The flee market alongside the Naini lake. It has few shops run by Tibetians. If you are from any of the metro city, the market is not for you since it sells things that you'll easily find in your local market. There are few street vendors selling hand made ladies socks made by pure wool which is really nice. This is one thing which you will not find easily anywhere else in India. Even if you find it, the rates would be much more higher than from that of Nainital.

title: Do not shop!
review: The market is called Tibetan but most of the items here are expensive by Mumbai standards. All the shopkeepers have king sized egos and attitudes and not helpful at all. The hawkers who line the street which comes to the market are much better and give good service.

title: Lots of good stuff to buy. But need to have good bargaining skills to pick up good bargain.
review: bought some wollen clothes. Expected stuff to be reasonably priced. But needed some good bargaining skills and most of lady luck to bargain.
